newsitem.title: USA: Remedy shares rebound almost 11 pct.
newsitem.headline: Remedy shares rebound almost 11 pct.

text.p: Remedy Corp. shares rose almost 11 percent Thursday in a robust recovery from the previous day.
Shares of Remedy, which writes software that allows corporate computer technicians to monitor and troubleshoot their network's performance, were up 9 3/4 to 95 at 1420 EDT/1820 GMT.
A spokeswoman said the company had no comment on stock activity and that it did not release any news that was material.
Jim Pickrel, an analyst at Hambrecht & Quist in San Francisco, said investors were taking advantage of a sharp drop Wednesday to buy Remedy's stock.
Remedy's shares have almost doubled in the past month on expectations of surging demand for software to simplify the management of complex computer networks and business processes.

On October 1, the company said it expected to report third-quarter earnings per share of $0.30, up from $0.15 a year ago. At the time of the announcement, analysts had been expecting Remedy to report a third-quarter profit of about $0.24 a share.
